wiki.summary: "Honey Boy" is a vibrant and infectious track by Swedish singer Benjamin Ingrosso, featuring German producer Purple Disco Machine, Jamaican artist Shenseea, and American musician Nile Rodgers. Released on May 3, 2024, under Sweat It Out and RCA Records, the song blends disco, funk, and modern pop, showcasing Ingrosso’s signature style. With groovy basslines, rhythmic guitar riffs, and dynamic vocals, "Honey Boy" captures the excitement of romance and carefree summer vibes. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: "Honey Boy" is a vibrant and infectious track by Swedish singer Benjamin Ingrosso, featuring German producer Purple Disco Machine, Jamaican artist Shenseea, and American musician Nile Rodgers. Released on May 3, 2024, under Sweat It Out and RCA Records, the song blends disco, funk, and modern pop, showcasing Ingrosso’s signature style. With groovy basslines, rhythmic guitar riffs, and dynamic vocals, "Honey Boy" captures the excitement of romance and carefree summer vibes. Ingrosso co-wrote the song with Anya Jones, Chinsea Linda Lee, Hampus Lindvall, Nile Rodgers, and Tino Schmidt, while production was handled by Rodgers, Purple Disco Machine, and Lindvall. The track received widespread acclaim for its catchy melody and polished production. EDM Tunes called it "an electrifying summer hit," while Culture Fix praised its danceable rhythm. Commercially, "Honey Boy" performed strongly in Europe, peaking at number two in Sweden and charting in Norway, Finland, Poland, Spain, and Lithuania, further cementing Ingrosso’s presence in the dance-pop scene. Accompanied by a visually striking music video with retro aesthetics and energetic choreography, the song’s appeal was further amplified by a remix from The Sponges. "Honey Boy" continues to highlight Ingrosso’s ability to merge classic influences with contemporary dance music, reinforcing his role as a leading figure in the genre. Read more on Last.fm.
